title: To Kill a Mockingbird
author: Harper Lee
description: A young girl in the racially charged American South learns about justice and compassion through her father’s defense of a black man accused of a crime.

author: George Orwell
description: A chilling portrayal of a totalitarian regime where Big Brother watches every move and independent thought is a crime.

title: The Great Gatsby
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
description: A mysterious millionaire’s obsession with a lost love reveals the emptiness behind the glitter of the Jazz Age.

title: Pride and Prejudice
author: Jane Austen
description: Elizabeth Bennet navigates love, social expectations, and personal growth in Regency-era England.

title: The Catcher in the Rye
author: J.D. Salinger
description: Holden Caulfield recounts a few turbulent days of teenage rebellion and alienation in New York City.

title: Moby-Dick
author: Herman Melville
description: Captain Ahab obsessively hunts the great white whale, exploring themes of revenge, fate, and man versus nature.

title: War and Peace
author: Leo Tolstoy
description: An epic tale of Russian families struggling with love and destiny during the Napoleonic wars.

title: The Hobbit
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: Bilbo Baggins embarks on an unexpected quest with dwarves to reclaim a treasure guarded by a dragon.

title: Crime and Punishment
author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
description: A poor student’s murder of a pawnbroker leads to guilt, paranoia, and philosophical debates on morality.

title: The Lord of the Rings
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: A fellowship sets out to destroy a powerful ring and defeat the dark lord Sauron in Middle-earth.

title: The Alchemist
author: Paulo Coelho
description: A young shepherd follows his dream across the desert in search of treasure and self-discovery.

title: Brave New World
author: Aldous Huxley
description: A futuristic society engineered for happiness hides the loss of individuality and true freedom.

title: Jane Eyre
author: Charlotte Brontë
description: An orphaned governess finds love and independence while uncovering a dark secret at Thornfield Hall.

title: Animal Farm
author: George Orwell
description: Farm animals overthrow their owner only to see power corrupt their ideals in a biting political allegory.

title: Wuthering Heights
author: Emily Brontë
description: A dark tale of passion, revenge, and obsession set on the wild Yorkshire moors.

title: The Picture of Dorian Gray
author: Oscar Wilde
description: A young man remains youthful while his hidden portrait bears the marks of his moral corruption.

title: The Kite Runner
author: Khaled Hosseini
description: A moving story of friendship, betrayal, and redemption set against the backdrop of a changing Afghanistan.

title: Life of Pi
author: Yann Martel
description: A shipwrecked boy survives on a lifeboat with a Bengal tiger, exploring faith and survival.

title: The Da Vinci Code
author: Dan Brown
description: A symbologist unravels a murder mystery that reveals hidden codes and ancient secrets of the church.

title: Harry Potter and the Sorcerer’s Stone
author: J.K. Rowling
description: An orphaned boy discovers he is a wizard and begins his magical education at Hogwarts School.

title: Les Misérables
author: Victor Hugo
description: An ex-convict seeks redemption while being pursued by a relentless inspector in revolutionary France.

title: Frankenstein
author: Mary Shelley
description: A young scientist’s attempt to create life results in a creature longing for acceptance and revenge.

title: The Odyssey
author: Homer
description: Odysseus faces mythical monsters and divine wrath on his decade-long journey home from Troy.

title: The Iliad
author: Homer
description: The wrath of Achilles drives this epic of heroism, pride, and tragedy during the Trojan War.

title: Dracula
author: Bram Stoker
description: A Transylvanian count spreads terror as a group of friends unite to stop his vampiric reign.

title: Don Quixote
author: Miguel de Cervantes
description: An aging nobleman sets out as a self-declared knight to revive chivalry, with comic misadventures.

title: The Brothers Karamazov
author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
description: A gripping exploration of faith, morality, and free will through the story of a family in conflict.

title: One Hundred Years of Solitude
author: Gabriel García Márquez
description: The rise and fall of the Buendía family mirrors a town’s mystical history in a sweeping multigenerational saga.

title: Fahrenheit 451
author: Ray Bradbury
description: In a future where books are banned, a fireman tasked with burning them begins to question his role.

title: The Stranger
author: Albert Camus
description: A detached man commits a senseless murder, leading to a trial that examines the absurdity of life.

title: Gone with the Wind
author: Margaret Mitchell
description: A spoiled Southern belle struggles for survival and love during the American Civil War and Reconstruction.

title: The Count of Monte Cristo
author: Alexandre Dumas
description: A man wrongly imprisoned escapes to seek justice and vengeance against those who betrayed him.

title: A Tale of Two Cities
author: Charles Dickens
description: Love, sacrifice, and revolution intertwine in this story set during the French Revolution.

title: Great Expectations
author: Charles Dickens
description: An orphan’s journey through social class and personal ambition leads to unexpected revelations.

title: The Grapes of Wrath
author: John Steinbeck
description: A poor family migrates west during the Great Depression, facing hardship and seeking dignity.

title: The Sun Also Rises
author: Ernest Hemingway
description: Disillusioned expatriates search for meaning in post–World War I Europe.

title: Catch-22
author: Joseph Heller
description: A darkly comic look at the absurdities of war and bureaucracy during World War II.

title: Beloved
author: Toni Morrison
description: A former enslaved woman is haunted by the ghost of her past in a powerful tale of memory and identity.

title: The Road
author: Cormac McCarthy
description: A father and son traverse a bleak, ash-covered America in search of safety and hope.

title: The Secret Garden
author: Frances Hodgson Burnett
description: An orphaned girl discovers a hidden garden that transforms lives with its healing magic.

title: The Little Prince
author: Antoine de Saint-Exupéry
description: A pilot stranded in the desert meets a young prince from another planet who shares profound truths.

title: Memoirs of a Geisha
author: Arthur Golden
description: The life of a young girl sold to a geisha house in Kyoto unfolds in a world of beauty and sacrifice.

title: The Girl with the Dragon Tattoo
author: Stieg Larsson
description: A journalist and a hacker uncover dark family secrets in a gripping Swedish mystery.

title: Cloud Atlas
author: David Mitchell
description: Interwoven stories across centuries reveal how actions ripple through time.

title: The Book Thief
author: Markus Zusak
description: In Nazi Germany, a young girl finds solace in stolen books while Death narrates her journey.
